intro: Sedum creticum subsp. cyrenaicum, commonly known as the Cyrenaic sedum, is a succulent plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its fleshy, erect stems and small, clustered leaves that are typically blue-green in color. The plant produces star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or orange during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and arid environments. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value, it is a popular choice for xeriscaping.
